description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2tl5r","text":"All serum samples were tested for Rickettsia IgG using a commercial ELISA kit (NovaTec Immunodiagnostica GmbH, Dietzenbach, Germany) according to the manufacturer’s instructions(S9).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":34,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"e3j27","text":"This is an open accessprotocoldistributed under the terms of theCreative Commons Attribution License,  which permits unrestricted use, distribution, and reproduction in any medium, provided the original author and source are credited","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":64,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":36}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E6E9E606F48E11EDA2FC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"btefu","text":"Dispense 100µl controls and diluted samples into their respective wells. Leave well A1 for substrate blank. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"583q5","text":"Cover wells with the foil supplied in the kit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2iej7","text":"Incubate for 1 hour at 22-25°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3324l","text":"When incubation has been completed, remove the foil, aspirate the content of the wells and wash each well four (4) times with 300 µl of Washing Solution. Avoid overflows from the reaction wells. The soak time between each wash cycle should be \u003e5 sec. At the end carefully remove remaining fluid by tapping strips on tissue paper prior to the next step! ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89an1","text":"Note: Washing is critical! Insufficient washing results in poor precision and falsely elevated absorbance values. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":114}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g8fv","text":"Dispense 100 µl IgG HRP conjugate into all wells except for the blank well (e.g. A1). Cover with foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"amu64","text":"Incubate for 30 min at room temperature in the dark. Do not expose to direct sunlight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8lald","text":"Repeat step 4. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9ckpd","text":"Dispense 100 µl TMB Substrate Solution into all wells ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2osta","text":"Incubate for exactly 15 min at room temperature in the dark. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":61}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1onq0","text":"10.Dispense 100 µl stop solution into all wells in the same order and at the same rate as for the TMB Substrate Solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7mju","text":"Any blue colour developed during the incubation turns into yellow. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":67}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7672u","text":"Note:Highly positive patient samples can cause dark precipitates of the chromogen!These precipitates have an influence when reading the optical density. Predilution of the sample with physiological sodium chloride solution, for example 1+1, is recommended. Then dilute the sample 1+100 with dilution buffer and multiply the results in NTU by","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":341}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kude","text":"11.Measure the absorbance of the specimen at 450/620 nm within 30 min after addition of the Stop Solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajc1h","text":"Adjust the ELISA Microwell Plate Reader to zerousing the substrate blank in well A1.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55a3o","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1c5eh","text":"If - due to technical reasons - the ELISA reader cannot be adjusted to zero using the substrate blank in well A1, subtract the absorbance value of well A1 from all other absorbance values measured in order to obtain reliable results! ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"298dg","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50eju","text":"Measure the absorbance of all wells at 450 nmand record the absorbance values for each control and patient sample in the distribution and identification plan. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22},{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgtsh","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c7ir","text":"Dual wavelength reading using 620 nm as reference wavelength is recommended. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":77}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7k8j1","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5d19","text":"Where applicable calculate the mean absorbancevaluesof all duplicates. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":31,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1e7d","text":"·Negative Control \u003c 0.2 absorbance units ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6mphp","text":"·Positive Control \u003e 0.8 absorbance units ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5t775","text":"·Cutoff Calibrator 0.25-0.55 absorbance units ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"24jj4","text":"·Cutoff Calibrator / Negative Control ratio \u003e 1.5","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5njr2","text":"·Positive Control / Cutoff Calibrator ratio \u003e 2.0 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5orqs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"161cs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9srd1","text":"If these criteria are not met, the test is not valid and must be repeated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bkt9o","text":"The cut-off is the mean absorbance value of the Cut-off control determinations. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"assa9","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5egf","text":"Example: Absorbance value Cut-off control 0.54 + absorbance value Cut-off control 0.52 =1.06 / 2 = 0.53 ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8b4dd","text":"Cut-off = 0.53 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4m7dq","text":"Samples are considered POSITIVE if the absorbance value is higher than 10% over the cut-off. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7iglr","text":"Samples with an absorbance value of 10% above or below the cut-off should not be considered as clearly positive or negative","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bppdl","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"90sok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9D3B03D0F48D11EDBAFD1988878AA57B","height":42,"id":373448,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mnykb6e6x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mnyib6e6x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/mnyjb6e6x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mnyhb6e6x.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed3i3","text":"Example:    (1.786 x 10)/(0.53 )= 34  NTU (NovaTec Units)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fdk9","text":"Cut-off:    		10 		NTU
 Grey zone:  		9-11 		NTU
 Negative:   		<9 		NTU
 Positive:   		>11              	NTU","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
